user_request: A short poem about a raven that visits a grieving man and repeats one word.
final_poem:
In shadows, under weeping skies so grey,  
A lone raven croaks a single 'nevermore', and stays away;   
Through hushed whispers of leaves that rustled with sorrow's echoes near his place beside the tombstone’s cold embrace.      
The grieving man listens as rain tattoos forgotten memories,  
His heart bared for time to heal and mourners come in solace pace;    
Each droplet a tear on heaven's face above his head sigh-hushed plea,   
"Remember me", but the raven’s word 'nevermore', unmoved by human fear.  
In this dance with grief and loss so heavy in its weight to bear —— still he stands beneath regretful stars' gaze;    
The world moves on without him, yet love for his lost kin remains unforgotten share.      
So the raven croaks 'nevermore', a whisper against man’s aching heart and tears –  
A testament to sorrow that through this pain he never truly cares as time weaves its golden thread into grief's tear-streaked air:    
Never shall I love thee, O Death; for in silence my dearly loved one sleeps —— yet even death cannot quench the raven’s repeating 'nevermore.'
